title: Riak Recap for September 1 - 2
description:
Posted on September 2, 2011

Afternoon, Evening, Morning, to All -

For today’s Recap: Meetups, new code, new production users, slide decks, and more.

Enjoy, and have a great weekend.

Mark

Riak Recap for September 1 – 2

  1. Basho Developer Ryan Zezeski is in Baltimore and is looking for other like-minded Baltimoreans for talk Riak with (for meetups. presos, etc.). If this is you, shoot an email to rzezeski@basho.com.
    → Some details here
  2. Mårten Gustafson (@martengustafson) posted a slide deck a few days ago from a recent talk he gave called “Approaching and evaluating NoSQL.” Riak gets a non-trivial mention. Thanks, Mårten!
    → Check them out here
  3. John Newman joined the Basho Team as a Developer Advocate.
    → Details here on the Basho Blog
  4. Riak 1.0 Preview Meetups are happening in both San Francisco and New York on September 8th. If you’re in the area and aren’t already registered, you should do so; seats are going fast.
    → SF
    → NYC
  5. We added three new logos to the “Who is Using Riak” page on the Wiki.
    → Clipboard (Thanks, Ken!)
    → GitHub (Thanks, Corey!)
    → Mochi Media
    (Thanks, David! Also, it should be said that Mochi has been in production for
    over year now.)
    → And if you’ve got a logo for the wiki, don’t hesitate to fork the wiki repo and add your details (or email me)
  6. Looks like Duncan McGreggor has his Django Riak Engine code up on GitHub. (I posted a link to the Launchpad repo for this code in the last recap.)
    → Code here
